title: Quiz 7: HIV/AIDS Management & Counseling
description: Assess understanding of HIV transmission modes, clinical staging, prevention strategies (VCT/PMTCT), and counseling.

questions.question: Which of the following are VALID modes of HIV transmission? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: HIV is transmitted via blood, sex, and mother-to-child. It is NOT transmitted by vectors or casual contact.

questions.question: Match the HIV clinical stage with its key characteristic:

pairs.right: No major signs, virus replicating silently

questions.explanation: The stages progress from infection to silent phase to minor symptoms to severe disease.
questions.hint: Advanced disease is the most severe.

questions.question: VCT stands for ___BLANK___ Counseling and Testing.
questions.hint: It means you choose to do it.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an Opportunistic Infection (OI)?
questions.explanation: PCP is a fungal infection that attacks immunocompromised lungs. The others are not infectious or opportunistic.
questions.hint: It's a specific pneumonia common in AIDS.

questions.question: Sexual intercourse with a virgin is a known cure for HIV/AIDS.
questions.explanation: This is a dangerous MYTH. There is no cure for HIV/AIDS, and this practice spreads the infection.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of PMTCT programs?

options.text: To Prevent Mother to Child Transmission of HIV

questions.explanation: PMTCT stands for Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission.

questions.question: What is the 'window period' in HIV infection?
questions.explanation: The period after infection but before antibodies are detectable by tests (seroconversion).
questions.hint: The time when you are infected but test negative.

questions.question: Order the hierarchy of HIV prevention strategies from individual to medical:
questions.explanation: Behavioral change -> Barrier protection -> Testing -> Medical intervention.
questions.hint: ABC strategy usually starts with behavior.
